website_summaries.verdict: A good option for undergrowth, thick hedges, and even small trees. The JawSaw design of this model makes it easy and safe to use for almost anyone.
pros: A pair of jaws surround the chain on this model, and the steel teeth of each jaw clench around the object being cut
User does not need to move or position the saw while cutting
Once the jaws are attached to the cutting location, the user needs only to make the cut, and the jaws hold the blade in place
Powerful enough for small household cutting jobs and maintenance on large properties
cons: The long recharge time for the battery may require users to have 2 batteries available to complete larger jobs

customer_reviews.title: but each tool we have purchased has been a true joy. My wife became so empowered
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't do reviews because Amazon requires it for a rating, but I do this for WORX products. Rarely can you say that a tool changed your life, but each tool we have purchased has been a true joy. My wife became so empowered, I had to stop her from trimming more trees. today I thought about trimming hedges which are high around the house. I thought about getting out the cord and decided, NO. Off to get a WORX trimmer. I am 66 and the convenience and weight are perfect. Kudos to the engineers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for clearing brush and overgrowth
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I have used it to cut up and down about 35 young trees and wild privet hedges where a chain saw is too much power and heavy duty ratcheting loppers are not enough. It works well. I would recommend that you always carry the socket tool with you to open the hatch and adjust the chain because it will slip off from time to time or may get caught under compression of the weight of the tree. I believe they made it primarily for branches. The mini chain saw comes out and cuts side to side when you push on the handle. I will post a photo later.
customer_reviews.author: OpenMind

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket
customer_reviews.text: I'm an "older woman" pushing my 70s and now have the care of our yard (2 acres) entirely on my shoulders. I am SO PLEASED with the Worx jawsaw! It is light enough for me to handle. I never have a problem getting it started (battery operated). It has enough power to make clean, efficient cuts. Just let the machine to the work. Anything too big for it to get in it's jaw I shouldn't be handling anyway.
customer_reviews.author: 4yrisonly

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little while to get the hang of using this--mostly because I'm not very strong. But, once I figured it out, I LOVE it! I now have 4 different tools in the Worx 20V set, and I love every one of them! This one lets me take care of projects that I would have had to hire someone for, and I like that independence!
customer_reviews.author: Terri E. Primavera

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Wish I had this thing a long time ago. Major time saver!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a Godsend!!! We live on a heavily wooded lot and every spring getting brush cleaned up and burned is a major chore. Cutting the branches small enough for the fire pit takes much time and is harder on my hands as I get older. Well, I fired this baby up today and went out to trim dead limbs off trees. Wow! Easy peasy! I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: debi southern ohio

customer_reviews.title: Jawsaw’s great, battery and charger are TRASH
customer_reviews.text: I love this Jawsaw. It works perfectly for what I need, and I usually use it with my other Greenwork tools. Thing is, the battery and ESPECIALLY the charger it comes with is terrible. 5-6 hour charge times for less than an hours work. Compare that to my 50 dollar Greenworks chainsaw that is 40V and charges in 1 - 2 hours. I’m having to spend an extra 80 dollars for a better battery and charger. It’s almost like they want you to shill out an extra hundred to use the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: wiring design problem
customer_reviews.text: This starts out quite useful as many have stated but why do they stop working after awhile? Take a look at this picture and you can see how repeated pushing of the handle in and out while cutting causes the wires in the handle to rub against a plastic part and eventually break, no power to the motor. My unit was out of warranty so I took it apart and found the problem, so will the manufacture own up and fix this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic alternative to a chainsaw for smaller jobs around the yard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to a chainsaw for people who are intimidated to use one and/or only need to cut smaller trees (4 inches or so). Sure the battery charger isn't the best, however once charged, the battery definitely lasts long enough for most jobs around the yard. Its very safe to operate (relative to a chainsaw), easy to use and has the added advantage of being able to cut branches/small logs that are laying flat on the ground without having to worry about nicking the ground and dulling the chain. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Brent R.

customer_reviews.title: Recalcitrant at Best
customer_reviews.text: My opinion of this product has declined since I purchased it in 2014. It worked fine out of the box for several sessions and I was about to rate it as a 4/5 but more recently the product has become recalcitrant by only sporadically engaging the limb to be cut. This in itself may be understandable and fixable - but what is not - is my inability to reach anybody at the customer help line. On hold for 20 minutes on 2 separate occasions and then left my # for promised callback - about a month ago and still counting. I will not purchase another Worx product until/unless they get their customer service under control and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: SkyKon

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two light uses of maybe 20 minutes each!
customer_reviews.text: If it worked it would be a great product but, it broke after our second use. The seller's customer service and warranty contact with the manufacturer very poor. A waste of money. It rains a lot where we live so we were not able to use the JawSaw until after a couple of weeks of getting it, so by the time it broke we were in week 6 and couldn't return the product to Amazon. Reached out to seller who told us to talk to the manufacturer. Well, we are still waiting for the manufacturer to respond. No service. My advice to you: Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Mills

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Solution
customer_reviews.text: I am accustomed to using electric or gas chainsaws that require careful attention and skill to avoid losing a limb or eye - or worse.* By comparison, it is hard to rate this one as dangerous, it is extremely light weight and the blade is never exposed. Cutting at ground level is also a big plus, a regular chainsaw is ruined by cutting into dirt. Used it ti clean up after a Nor'easter, looking forward to using it to clear trails of scrub poplar and low branches. *Since I wear a Kevlar "apron" with a regular chainsaw, it is great not to have the extra bulk when using this one.
customer_reviews.author: QuinnsGma

customer_reviews.title: Manificient
customer_reviews.text: I had a tree that on an incline and even the tree men was not willing to trim, everyone was afraid there blade would brake or not be strong enough to trim the tree. The tree needed to be trimmed, some of the branches were thick, so with this tool I tried my hand at it. At first, I did not understand clearly how to operate the tool, its a button and push in on the handle to operate, thereafter, my only concern was balance on the incline, the tool worked excellent. The thicker one tool a little more effort, but it cut through the branches as described. Any level place it would be much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful pruning product!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing chain saw!! It is the perfect choice for someone learning how to saw for the first time. The safety features are incredible, and the directions for its use and how to tighten the chain are very simple. It is light enough that this makes a wonderful pruning tool for women, elderly people, or younger people. It works extremely well and enables a person to prune her own trees and bushes because it can cut up to 4 inches. It is not designed for chopping down trees - unless they are 4inches or less, but it is a fabulous pruning tool! Perhaps it’s best feature is that it does all this while remaining a very light tool.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lady

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Grandma and I used it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty small with small wrist and not a lot of strength so I was worried. Actual had for months without using because I was nervous about it. Watched a lot of Youtubes showing grandma's like me using it and when I had a project I absolutely needed a chain saw on...I fired it up. So easy and safe. Could have saved me lots of time through the years. Have an area of brush that's 3in or less in size and even though a guy with a regular chainsaw could make fast work of it...I can get it and stay safe. Love this. Also the Komok Pruning shears sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Happy

customer_reviews.title: It's long for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This tool's ability to cut up loose branches on the ground into pieces small enough to be grabbed with a trash picker and tossed into a wheeled trash container, without bending over even once, is just the best thing ever. At first glance, the saw looks like it might be unbalanced, too long and awkward to handle, but that impression is gone after just a few seconds of use. A one handed sawzall with a 12" Diablo pruning blade is an easy way to cut branches off trees, but sawzalls and chainsaws are a PITA to use for cutting up small branches on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Missing battery charger, too top heavy
customer_reviews.text: 1. The box was missing a battery charger. How do I charge the battery? 2. The box was beaten up and did not look factory taped. I have bought other Worx products and they arrived properly taped. Need to check if this is somebody's return that has been palmed off to me. 3. This saw requires a lot of safety measures. it is unforgivable that the so-called "user manual" is just a few pages of unexplained drawings. 4. This thing is very top heavy and holding it aloft requires a lot of strength. Using the extender would make it even worse.
customer_reviews.author: kayceefan2000

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for men and WOMEN!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of always waiting on my husband to use the chainsaw when trimming of trees. So I bought this for myself, I'm 59 years old. It is been the greatest thing. Not hard to use. Safe to use. Lightweight. I do have to fix the chain that pops off occasionally, but even that isn't hard. In fact i'm not sure I'm going to let my husband use it LOL. My daughter borrowed it and she loved it also. It's not for big trees where you would use a chainsaw, but it's good for trimming small stuff around your house thats too big for smaller tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Stoud

customer_reviews.title: They work great when they work
customer_reviews.text: They work great when they work. The first one quit working after six uses. Returned it and received a replacement which quit working after the second use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Metheny

customer_reviews.title: most useful gadget we've purchased in a long time
customer_reviews.text: This Jawsaw is probably the coolest, most useful gadget we've purchased in a long time. We have a lot of buckthorn to clear from our property and this has made our tedious job much easier. It holds a charge a long time. The saw is light and easy to handle. However, the chain has needed sharpening several times already and I've ordered a spare to use while the other chain is being sharpened. I suspect the buckthorn, which is quite sappy this time of year, has been the cause of the dull chains, but it's far easier to handle than any of our chainsaws and seems safer to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: TreeHugger

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.text: So although i purchased this saw a while ago i have now used it myself and i am disappointed to say within the first couple uses cutting small ( 3 inches maybe ) branches the saw's teeth easily bend and chain falls off constantly but i think more importantly by the 3rd use just cutting up small brush/ branches that even pruning shears cut thru this saw no longer turns on ..Also battery life on full charge is maybe 15-20 minutes . Very disappointed in purchase and do not recommend wish it were different
customer_reviews.author: Gabriele

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Clearly designed for right handed people but sympathetic to those of us who are lefties, giving us our own safety release button. The saw works great on tree limbs when cutting from top to bottom, but the chain gets stuck and jams if cutting from bottom to top, which is how it cuts if using it left handed. This really isn’t that important, just something to be aware of. Works fast and quietly. Felt very safe to use. On the extension pole it feels very heavy and less easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: A great piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: After looking it over online, I decided that this this would be, at minimum, a good tool for my wife to use. I am nervous about her using a normal chain saw, since I had already given myself a nasty slice on my thigh! Ooops. Anyway, I find that I really like this tool. 1. It's cordless, which is so handy for a small job. It cuts 3-4" stuff no problem. 2. It is safe. You would be hard pressed to get in trouble with this thing. 3. I love that you can cut a limb on the ground without stooping over OR digging the chain in the dirt. Overall, fantastic for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Lyerly

customer_reviews.title: This is the best yard tool in my arsenal
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I chopped down an entire gigantic hedge with what seemed like hundreds of hardwood branches that were up to 4” or 5” thick and then it chopped all of those gangly branches into smaller pieces right on the ground. All on a single battery charge. This is super quiet and powerful. It cut the hardwood like it was butter and it didn’t hang up like a chain saw can when you get near the end of a cut. The chain automatically tensions and it barely used any chain oil. Love it !!
customer_reviews.author: Louis Rutigliano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for removing Rhododendron would be great for Hurricane cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I have allot of overgrown Rhododendron on a steep hill and this is the perfect tool for removing it. Its much safer than a standard chainsaw when you are working with uneven footing. recommend you buy a couple of extra batteries if you don't already have them. Worx is a great choice for this because the replacement batteries are much more affordable than other name brands. remember to check the oil levels as you are working Love it - would absolutely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmi the fish

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter; dependable
customer_reviews.text: So far there’s so much to like about this chain saw cutter from cutting branches that are thick in the trees. I use them to cut branches that stick out and it the fences and sometime they damage the fences. So they need cutting. This thing cuts like butter. The only thing I don’t like is it’s reach but that’s how chain saws are and so I also bought the pole that connects to it. It’s fun using this. You just want to chop up everything in a forest backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Best Saw Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Worx! All their products are brilliantly engineered to be useful. I have over an acre of land and I am using this jaw saw to cut out large sage brush around the fence line and brush too big to mow. I do not have electricity so the battery was a must. My 11 year old can use this with ease. Battery life is good, first charge an hour. Once used a couple of times about two hours on a charge. Weight is easy to handle. The chain stays on, is easy to tighten, and the oil is simple to put in. I have nothing bad to say about this saw. I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.

customer_reviews.title: Came in a packaing box
customer_reviews.text: First off, I ordered the one without the battery. It didn't come in a retail box but a standard packaging gray box. I thought it was a refurbished item and reordered another unit. The shipped it in the same type of box so I kept the 2nd unit. Works pretty good but the 20V battery is a little weak for this tool. I've about 4 tools using the same 20V battery. If you're using the Worx 20V system, then wait for it to go sale. If you don't already own a Worx 20V system, then I would buy a larger battery operated chain saw with more power.
customer_reviews.author: LA88

customer_reviews.title: Every household should have one of these!
customer_reviews.text: Whoa! This product works exactly as advertised! I'm not a strong person and am easily able to handle taking down small trees then cutting them into fire pit size. Weighs less than 8lbs. Simple to operate in every way. Comes with everything you need. Battery lasts about as long as my energy lasts. Synchronicity! And it's totally safe. I feel very comfortable using this. I didn't get the extention pole because I'm not using it on things high up. I think the extension pole would make this strenous to operate.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but really quite heavy
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful machine. Would not suggest ordering the extension pole due the the sheer weight of the jawsaw. While I am in top physical shape, most people would struggle trying to hoist this heavy chain saw far up in the air to trim branches. I have always used the Black & Decker Alligator Saw, which works differently. I am not sure if I would replace this unit when it eventually starts to wear out.
customer_reviews.author: J Skydell

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This arrived earlier this week and I charged it up and tried it out. Love it, cuts through three inch (diameter) branches like butter. I have trimmed with it above my head, on the ground (roots) and cleaned up quiet a bit already. I bought this property last year and a lot had been left to overgrow by the previous owners, a chainsaw would have been more difficult for me to handle but this does the job, is lightweight and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Riedel

customer_reviews.title: This saw is amazing. I managed to trim so many trees
customer_reviews.text: This saw is amazing. I managed to trim so many trees, well and instead of the long slow hand saw. Wonderful. Just make sure you have a big jug of the chain oil so you don't wreck it. It went thru the small bottle it comes with in about an hour, maybe a little longer, so make sure you have at least a quart on hand.
customer_reviews.author: luckyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Wasnt expecting much
customer_reviews.text: Really wasn't expecting much. A novelty with low power, really. HA. This thing is a little beast! My wife used it to cut out big roots while pulling stumps. Also used it while chopping limbs for the chipper, and it really went...and went...and went. It sounds wussy, looks funny, but holy crow. This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: N. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked 4 months and quit. So far no response on warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: Quality not there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these and they both stopped working within 2 uses. I would stay away from worx products. Tool idea is amazing and when it worked it was great, that’s why I tried the second attempt.
customer_reviews.author: ipad

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with the part to reach branches
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use the saw for the first time and loved it - really easy to set up and to use. Gets the job done! I was however disappointed to realize after it came in that it doesn’t come with the extension piece as shown in the video and pictures. Maybe I misread the small print somewhere, but the branches I had hoped to cut down will have to wait until I order the additional part. Then again the battery wouldn’t last long enough anyway. Highly recommend ordering a second battery when purchasing to avoid having to wait around!
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Worx Jawsaw too Finicky!
customer_reviews.text: Like the idea of this jawsaw, just too finicky! Chain requires more attention, breaking up the workflow, Poor oiler! Have to recommend you find yourself a WEN Battery Powered Chainsaw! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Our first jawsaw was an Worx electric one. Loved it. The jaws closed over the item and the saw did its thing. The jaws held the branch firm while the saw did its job. The battery saw does not work the same. The jaws do not close so the branch is able to move or wobble making it much harder to saw. So disappointed in the difference between the electric and battery saws.
customer_reviews.author: T J. Grabo

customer_reviews.title: WORX Jawsaw is unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is incredible! I'm 66 years old and live on a large wooded acreage. Chainsaws have been hard for me to handle and the wild saplings are so dense it makes it harder to use one. But the Jawsaw makes it so much easier for me to do a lot of clearing without trouble. The size of the jaw opening is wonderful and fitting it into tight spaces is much easier. Thank you WORX for offering this awesome tool!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Ashbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: It works well on small trees and branches. Very lightweight and my wife loves to use it. Battery life is pretty good too. Only issue is the chain has popped off twice now. It is pretty quickly reattached but is a pain and shouldn’t happen this frequently. Overall recommend though
customer_reviews.author: Jamey

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable!
customer_reviews.text: I seldom bother to review products, but the Jawsaw is such an useful piece of equipment that each time I use it I think: "I MUST write a review of this!" It handles those mid-size cutting jobs that are too big for loppers but too small to deserve the effort and potential risk of a regular chain saw. 4"-diameter firewood logs burn well without needing to be split, which saves me time and effort. The battery life was better than I expected, but it helps to have a spare. I've had my Jawsaw for almost a year, and wish I'd found it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. L. Andrew Ball

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt get it away from my neighbor. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product. Dont think twice, it is exactly as described, so easy to use, worth every penny. We have large country yard where sumac is a constant issue. It is easy to use and maintain. Im a 60 yr old woman, the weight is not an issue. My 80 year old neighbor, experienced with chain saws, has outdoor stove/furnace showed me how to use first time, thought id never get it away from him. He ordered one the next week. Worx makes quality products, no hype, if they claim a product feature, trust it to be true. Update: Still works perfectly. Use it regularly. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sutphin Reed

customer_reviews.title: It died
customer_reviews.text: I loved this saw until it died last week. I thought that there was something wrong with the battery, ie, needing a charge so I charged the battery and checked the saw today. It's dead. Amazon can't help me because I bought the item in mid-May. However, now I need to find the information to contact the manufacturer. I am highly displeased, as I buy a lot from Amazon and when in chat, the guy just blew it off and didn't answer my question for the contact information.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Decelles

customer_reviews.title: Great for around the yard.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Was able to trim a bunch of branches around the yard on a single charge. Much better than getting out the chainsaw just to trim a some small branches. Took me longer to clean up all of the branches than it did to cut them. Has plenty of power. The only complaint is that it's a little hard to see the level of the chain oil in the reservoir so I over filled it the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Lar

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. I cannot express to you enough how much I LOVE LOVE LOVE this Jawsaw. It is literally the best tool I have ever purchased and if you could see my Amazon history you would know that's saying a lot. I bought it in March and I have cut down SO many trees, shrubs, even cut up old gross dock boards. It's unbelievable how easy this thing is to operate and it certainly feels safer than anything else I use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so he could feel like he is helping
customer_reviews.text: Works as it says. I bought this for my disabled father, who needed something that he could work without endangering me or mainly himself, so he could feel like he is helping. he handles the brush and limbs as I am cutting up the larger parts of the tree. used often and keeps up with him. He tires out long before the battery does. I am impressed with the safety and useful of this tool. whats nice is he can use it as a support (cane) for short distances.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with the JawSaw
customer_reviews.text: I seriously thought that this was a gimmick and I'd be sending it back. But it's not. It works far beyond what I imagined. When adding the extension pole, it becomes "top heavy" If they could come up with a material they can use that'll change the heaviness of it. It would be more than awesome. Shouldn't say much more, they'll end up raising the price.
customer_reviews.author: trenches

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, the battery lasts longer than I do.
customer_reviews.text: While skeptical I purchased the saw and find it to be well balanced, safe to use and has a good strong battery that has longer lasting endurance than I do. From tree trimming to small scruffy overgrowth it works well, easier than my chainsaw much of the time. Not for big trees but things up to 5-6 inches it ‘eats’ with ease.
customer_reviews.author: K9 Scrib

customer_reviews.title: not very good
customer_reviews.text: I had some lopping to do and used to have a cordless B&D Gator...I saw this Worx saw as an alternative so I thought Id give it a try. the first I cut with this saw , I checked to make sure that the chain wasn't on backwards...terribly slow cutting and difficult to operate...I would recommend the Gator over this one
customer_reviews.author: vchateau

customer_reviews.title: JawSaw is perfect for Home Owners & Storm Clean Up for trees ...
customer_reviews.text: JawSaw is perfect for Home Owners & Storm Clean Up for trees or branches under 4" in diameter. Light weight makes it EZ to use with less fatigue Thanks to the design-less Kneeling or Bending than with traditional chainsaws. The Jaws do hold branch in place to avoid chain skipping or bouncing which is nice. 2nd Battery Highly recommended since run time is only 20 minutes, Otherwise, would have given 5 star rating,
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Nathan H. Rodee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: I got my Jawsaw yesterday. After charging the battery overnight I started cleaning up the limbs. I had a lot down in my pasture and around the yard. We had terrible winds this year. I cut up two truckloads. Excellent!! It cut up the limbs into manageable sizes with no problem. My husband still has the bigger logs to cut up with the chainsaw but I was aware that the Jawsaw would only cut up to 4" logs. Well worth the money. Also I have the Worx Weed Eater with 2 batteries. The batteries for it fits the Jawsaw. I didn't need them. All that sawing and the battery was still going strong. I'm a 65 year old woman.
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, it makes it very easy to do yard work and the battery last a long time. It's really nice not to have to have to worry about the oil getting to the blade. If used the way you are supposed to, the chain staying on is not a problem. It is capable of cutting larger limbs than I thought, really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Cubtex

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Being a girl with little upper body strength, I am always worried about using chain saws and having adequate control over them. I love this jaw saw! I feel completely safe with it! Light weight and easy to use in the air or on the ground. It took a few lessons from my neighbor on how tight the chain should be, but after that...I was good to go!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great product for any non-handy man
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a handy man and did horrible job regarding to yard word. We have a big tree in the front yard. This year I decided to give this a try and purchased the power jawsaw. It's really easy to use even for an armature like me. I cut three thick branches out and that worth much more than the price we paid for this JawSaw. Very happy about the result.
customer_reviews.author: War Eagle, Hey!

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Battery would not charge. Had to return it. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Darbie

customer_reviews.title: No more begging the husband to cut down brush growing ...
customer_reviews.text: No more begging the husband to cut down brush growing next to the driveway or on the edge of the property. This saw cuts threw everything and does it with ease. In fact, even this wife can use it ease. I am definitely considering this as a gift for other family members.
customer_reviews.author: Funky Family Farm

customer_reviews.title: SAFE AND EASY
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use! I feel very safe about being nowhere near the cutting blade and the jaw holding branches from swinging into you once cut thru! I have five power share items now and can easily use batteries from other items when this runs low if i have a lot of trimming at once. Just ordered the extension pole!
customer_reviews.author: K. FITZPATRICK

customer_reviews.title: This was not in NEW condition, but I LOVE this tool
customer_reviews.text: The tool arrived in a box that had been opened before, and a mouse or rat had obviously been in the box. The tool was covered in rodent excrement. The instructions were also covered and smelled disgusting. It did not appear to have been previously used, but it was disgusting. Rather than go through the return process, I took my Lysol disinfectant cleaner and gloves and a mask and cleaned the tool. The tool itself is awesome! I truly love using it. It's light weight, easy to operate, and works like a charm. I also love how safe I feel with the grips that hold the branches and the shield from the flying bark dust. Really brilliant design.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K. Boutwell

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase! It’s light and easy to use, it’s also very effective. I watched several videos and read many reviews before actually committing. Im happy I did. It’s basically ready out of the box, I charged the battery for a couple of hours though and started working in the yard. I’ve cut down several trees, battery still good with plenty of power. My yard looks great and not over grown like before. Some of the best money I have spent on a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: It took 12 plus hours to charge and when it ...
customer_reviews.text: It took 12 plus hours to charge and when it was it wouldn't cut anything larger than a couple inches .Anything bigger and it would just stop. Sent it back the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly powerful AND almost fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are almost fun to use. I got one to do quick cuts between pole saw and larger chain saw work. It does alot of the work I would otherwise have used my pole saw for. I was so impressed, I bought one for my adult son and daughter! after they tried mine. I usually get so carried away, I just keep finding things to cut until the battery needs charging.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kool

customer_reviews.title: It works great, I purchased it to clear vines in the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great, I purchased it to clear vines in the forest around my house and I would definitely recommend this tool for that purpose, the jaws really help hold the vines steady while cutting them off trees, I used to use a regular chain saw because clippers wouldn't cut these vines, but with the regular chainsaw I was chasing the vine as it bounced around, so this is a definite improvement that is much safer. I tested it on some branches and some brush, and it did the job really well.
customer_reviews.author: mm790

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this Worx Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I've used this Worx Chainsaw for a few weeks now and I have to say I'm liking way more than I thought I would. It is a great little tool for limbs and small trees around my house. Even the small 20V battery has surpassed my expectations for power and battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Porkunit

customer_reviews.title: They are great tools but they quit working
customer_reviews.text: The fact that for no reason they just stop working. I was cutting up a small tree branch and all of a sudden it would do nothing. I swapped out the battery but it still would not work. I will say that the Worx Customer service was great about sending a new one but I just want one that continues to work
customer_reviews.author: Keith Barnette

customer_reviews.title: Returned. Poor battery life and high oil use.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor battery life. The instructions say to charge the battery for at least 5 hours before use. I charged mine overnight and still only got 1.5 hours use out of it. Then it took another 6 hours to recharge. Also, this machine goes through chain oil like it’s going out of style! I’m also unimpressed with the cutting ability of this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Despain

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy short battery life, terrible manual!
customer_reviews.text: First the manual simply sucks. Written in a very small font. The battery takes three hours to charge. The battery while using last Round 10 minute's. I cut around 3" Branch's at the thickest. Just seemed like there was never enough power to get the job done. Don't buy it's very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sirden1959

customer_reviews.title: Meh... gud if one owns 1/4 acre
customer_reviews.text: I own maybe 8 chainsaws for my 10 acres. Gas, electric, pole, etc. Bought for quicky cuts and so my wife cud use; she can't! Blade pivot is mediocre... unit is heavy... it runs 20% the speed of my 110v units. I can use but wife wud rather use the 12" 110v unit!
customer_reviews.author: dralexy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says, but...
customer_reviews.text: This saw works well, but, the chain falls off frequently. So, you need to take the saw apart and reattach the chain after about 15 minutes of use. The battery that came with it is decent. All in all, I would purchase it again because it is an easy way to take down all of those pesky box elders, Chinese elms, and buckthorns!
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Antaramian

customer_reviews.title: A must for the farm
customer_reviews.text: Such a handy tool, I don't know what we ever did without this one! It is so easy to use and convenient to grab as well as super safe! it does not replace a chainsaw but it can sure make the prep work simpler for the sawyer. It's a must have tool!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Collins

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised and cool tool.
customer_reviews.text: works well, wish it had more power and the battery lasted longer, good for about 20-25 cuts on 3-4" branches and a lot more on smaller branches. On the larger branches you can hear it struggling. All that said I'm happy and it is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worx too good
customer_reviews.text: I shouldn't have bought this. Now I look at my yard and think, what should I remove now. It is so easy to use, it works great and does exactly what you want. I am glad I didn't but the extender, because I would still be out in my yard cutting stuff down.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter4goodies

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through wood like butter. I needed it to cut trunks off ...
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastically! Cuts through wood like butter. I needed it to cut trunks off at ground level and it works great. It is easy to use as a pruning device. The battery lasts a long time. I appreciate the automatic oiler, one reason I picked this over another brand and the auto tension adjustment. For those that have the chain coming off, I would suggest setting the tension and allowing the blade to come up to speed before cutting wood. I have not experienced that or any problems with this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Womack

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after after 2nd around 50 cuts
customer_reviews.text: It was working great until it just stopped working out of the blue. Replacing the fully charged battery but it didn't help. It seemed that there was no power to the motor. I Just bought it 2 weeks ago, so I will return this or maybe exchange for another. There are so many negative reviews regarding this issue, i think Worx must look into this.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool!
customer_reviews.text: This little gem is a game changer! I am a single woman with almost an acre of land and quite frankly, chainsaws scare the daylights out of me! This is lightweight, cuts like butter and is super easy to use! I am so pleased that I can finally trim and cut down trees without fear. I would recommend this to anyone! Especially do it yourself women!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lopping downed limbs. Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised and really is a timesaver. I had piles of larger branches laying around and I could just walk along the length without bending over and one handed lop everything into manageable lengths. It will cut stuff as large as the opening, but be patient and let the blade to the work. Liked the automatic oiler and the plunging action really does work well. I was going to get the other chain lopper by the other company but that works like a big pair of scissors, so was a two handed operation and more awkward. This is perfect for chopping up stuff on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: JAWSAW a great tool.  Great tool between a lopper and a chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Rob, not Claire, but I am the one using the JAWSAW. Great for removing small branches around the house and acreage, and cutting smaller branches into firewood. I have not used JAWSAW on bamboo yet but I think it will perform well. I definitely recommend this product, and I am NOT pimping for Amazon, although they are good people to deal with! Finding the WORX JAWSAW fuel is a problem, however!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Everitt

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this model.
customer_reviews.text: Stop cutting after about 10-15 cuts. Didn't know this was the cheap model. My other two lasted until a tornado blew my shed away destroying most of my tools. Guess I will try another brand but this is my first tol from Worx that failed.
customer_reviews.author: George Walton

customer_reviews.title: Great not scary chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this little chain saw. I feel comfortable using it . It is not scary like a regular chain saw. wish I could mount it so that I could hold the wood and not have to bring it to the wood. But it is still great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but definitely need extra batteries!
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me and uncomfortable when it comes to using a chain saw, this is a good and safe alternative. Works well. Easy to use. Nut it has limitations, and it's basically a pruning tool. Good for cutting up small and medium sized branches, not cutting down trees. Battery life is short, however. About 30 min. for me. So I recommend getting additional batteries if you plan on cutting for longer than a half hour at a time. There is a corded version available, but for the size of my property that was not an option.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy to cut branches that it feels like cheating
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like having the right tool for the job. Pros: Powerful saw Easy to use Cons: kind of heavy for my wife (specially with the pole) Not compatible with the higher voltage batteries from Worx (I also have the 40v edge trimmer) Bottom line: Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: The Magician

customer_reviews.title: I use it more then my chainsaw these days!
customer_reviews.text: I love this WORX jawsaw! It does a great job cutting brush around my property. My wife loves it too because it is so safe! I also purchased the extension pole to trim trees. Does a great job! I find myself using this WAY more often then my chainsaw anymore. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley James

customer_reviews.title: It is still dangerous like any chainsaw but probably the safest one I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for Mom and she loves it. It is still dangerous like any chainsaw but probably the safest one I have ever seen. Buy an extra battery if you plan to do a lot of work. It lasts awhile but doesn't give much warning when it's running low on juice, just stops mid cut.
customer_reviews.author: travis21

customer_reviews.title: Burnt up with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a few months with minimal use. Then burnt up. I not only wasted my money on this, but bought 3 extra batteries and chargers that are useless now. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Tappy

customer_reviews.title: Great fence line brush tool
customer_reviews.text: This is surpringly well built. I only used it a few times to clear brush close to fence line. Very easy to push in and cuts fast and clean. The jaw eliminates any risk of catchi g blade on fence.
customer_reviews.author: TexasRancher

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!! Cleared a fence line in no time flat. When I bought it, I figured I would have to constantly be tightening the chain or putting it back on but it's really easy to get along with as long as you remember to tighten the chain after about every 7-8 cuts, empty the shavings and it doesn't snag on anything. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Anna Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but I keep getting it stuck
customer_reviews.text: I'd rate it five stars but the design causes it to get stuck sometimes. A Black and Decker unit I have with scissors jaws is less prone to this problem. I like the saw and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: Good too to grab for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I like how the saw grabs the branch and constricts toward the blade. This tool is used by my wife and she really likes it for light trimming and small branches. The saw can see a bit top heavy but still can be managed.
customer_reviews.author: JamSol

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! Get this!
customer_reviews.text: I always write in my reviews that i am no handy man. So, when working on my yard, i told wife that i need to buy chain saw to cut some bushes and small trees, she declined :p she said i could not be trusted with a regular chain saw due to my ahem "handy abilities". Any how, i got this and boy does this get the job done! Only bad part is that batteries run out after tree very big bushes (4 inches) so buy an extra pack if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Raz

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been raving to all my friends about this saw. I even posted on facebook about it. I love it. My mission is to cut down a hillside of scrub oak for fire mitigation. Because of this saw I'm going to be able to accomplish this. I'm 65 so I don't have the upper body strength that I used to, but with this saw it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Paisley Heart

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: been getting my branch pile whittled down to size. love it
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use —read/follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: This tool is one of the greatest inventions!!! This is my second one. Storm damage? No problem—cleans up super fast!! I even help neighbors because it’s so easy. I LOVE THIS THING!!!
customer_reviews.author: kdyge

customer_reviews.title: This will work.
customer_reviews.text: Came very well protected faster delivery than expected. I'm assuming battery will last as long as weedwhacker. 20 to 25 minutes. Long enough for me to ue without resting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feel safe using unlike the traditional chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: I’m in a wheelchair which makes it awkward to use, but I’ll figure it out. Cuts great. Have wanted one for awhile so was happy to see the price drop. Got it next day since it came from my state. The shipping box was huge to protect the saw from damage. A person could live in that box.
customer_reviews.author: butitsadryheat

customer_reviews.title: Best and safest saw ever.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. I'm a 60 y/o woman. I cut down 5 small trees growing too close to my fence without a problem. I plan to cut down overgrown bushes in the spring. This jawsaw is awesome. Buy one, saves time and so simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Emily and Joels mom

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent at cutting limbs on the ground
customer_reviews.text: I push small trees over with my farm tractor and then if they are 4" or less, I use the Jawsaw to cut them up into fireplace or firepit size logs. I recommend getting extra batteries if you are going to use it for a lot of cuts at one time. I have two additional ones. Love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worked for bamboo...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, not too heavy for 71 y/o woman. I got it for large areas of bamboo. I ended up using it for 1”+ diameter bamboo and just using pruners for the smaller ones (although it will work on the smaller ones as well). The battery lasted as long as I needed.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieD

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily for my wife to use since we have lots of small trees with trunks less than 6 inches thick that need to be thinned out and then cut up into firewood. We have done about 50 so far and the only trouble we have had is the chain comes off occasionally if we let the tree pinch the blade when cutting. The charge lasts as long as we want to work, which is usually a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this for camping and small jobs around home. Being battery operated we can use in the campgrounds where chinsaws are not allowed. No one can hear this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Invention
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest invention ever. I have been using it for clearing small trees that are growing up next to our shed. The ease of use and safety of this Jawsaw can not be beat. It zips thru the small logs and branches very quickly, making the task super easy to accomplish for me. I am a 54 year old woman who likes to undertake all possible jobs around the farm myself and this Jawsaw was just the ticket to add to my personal arsenal of work tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for a single mom/woman with a yard/flower bed to tend to
customer_reviews.text: Great for women as it's easier to handle than a chain saw. Chain has fallen off many times tho. Seems like the instructions for tightening the chain is off- just tighten it as tight as u can and it'll quit falling off. GREAT for property clean up but no cutting big trees/logs with this.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the ads.
customer_reviews.text: This saw does everything the ads claim! I don't like using a gasoline chain saw in brush clearing due to kickback danger, this thing is virtually impossible to kickback, also the fact that you can cut limbs flat on the ground without the chain hitting the dirt is a real plus. The oiler works fine but the oil is lighter than most bar oils. It is necessary to tap or shake the chips out of the jaws occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Semi Hysterical  in Ky

product_meta.title: WORX WG320 20V Power Share Cordless 6-inch JawSaw Chainsaw with Auto-Tension
product_meta.description: Style:Battery + Charger IncludedThe WORX WG320 Max Lithium Cordless JawSaw has all the features of the standard JawSaw plus cordless convenience. Powered by our 20-volt Max lithium battery, the JawSaw is now free of cords and portable. This cordless JawSaw is the lightweight, portable, and safe way to tackle pruning and trimming jobs around the house, camping, or after storm damage. No pull starting; no more gas/oil mixes; no more exhaust smells; safer, and no more tangled cords. The 20-volt MAX lithium battery technology resists self-discharge for much longer periods of time, and it has the ability to perform a quick partial charge without worrying about “memory effect” damaging your battery. The LithiumPower battery is lighter in weight and more compact. The JawSaw features an auto-tensioning which guarantees optimum tension on the chain, along with an automatic oiler with level indicator to keep chain maintenance and performance at its peak.
feature_bullets: [THE SAFEST SAW AROUND] The Jawsaw is the one and only chain saw with a fully protective guard. When not in use the blade retracts into the base. And because of that guard, this is the only chainsaw made for cutting directly on the ground. Leave the log right there on the pavement and get to work
[CUTS THICK BRANCHES] Saw through material up to 4 inches in diameter. And with its innovative single action cutting mechanism, you’ve never had so much easy to use cutting power
[THE CHAIN STAYS TIGHT] Auto-tension feature guarantees optimum tension at all times. This patented system ensures you’ll always have the most efficient cut
[THE CHAIN STAYS OILED] Features an automatic chain oiler with oil level indicator, which extends the life of the saw, the blade, the chain, and makes smoother cuts
[DO IT ALL WITH THE SAME BATTERY] Do it all with WORX PowerShare, the only cordless tool platform that uses the same battery to power 20V and 40V tools

[LIGHT ENOUGH TO USE OVERHEAD] The Worx Jawsaw weighs 7.1 lbs. without the battery attached. Not only is that light for a chainsaw – the even weight distribution and safety jaw guard bolster the tool and make it easy to maneuver around overhead branches
[FAST ENOUGH TO GET IT DONE] The no-load speed for the Jawsaw is 1350 rpms, making it one of the fastest in its class. You’ll appreciate the speed when you start making smooth, even cuts

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars731 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
